Deep in the ally of the major city, a person in good suit was running away from something...or someone. As the person was running away,it heard the running noise from behind and he soon realised that he was in dead end. He turned around and saw 2 well suited person catching up. They were the mafia, and the person was the former member of the gang who defected it. As the female took out the colt .95, she aimed at the person to kill. Fearing for its life, the person covered himself until the void opened beneath it, dropping him down and closed...

Who will you be?

111.content:
"Ahhhhh!"

That was the only thing the young male could shout as he was falling down in the unknown purplish thing with may eyes. As he was falling more, the gap opened beneath him and he landed on the back. The gap closed as the young man got up slowly, petting his head from the pain and looked around. He didn't know where he were as the surrounding was different. Instead of the city where he was chased down by his former mafia members, he was in open area.

"Where..am I?" Young man spoke.

He got up and started to walk the field. The air was actually great, and there were no pavement or any form of cars. He continued to wonder why he was in this area, or where he was to be presice. As he walked, the gap opened beneath him, making him fall again. He was scared and once he got out of the gap, he was now at...
111.title: into new land

He didn't know why he was there

He turned a sees a girl in red and white looking at him and her is holding some kind of stick. "Who are you?" The he asked scared. "I am Reimu Hakurei. Shrine Maiden here at the Hakurei shrine. And just why are you here?" Reimu asked annoyed. He soon
1111.title: The annoyed Shrine Maiden

choices: ...in a bed with two miko watching over you.
...strapped to a surgical bed in a familiar emergency room.
11111.content:
You open your mouth about to answer the question, but it suddenly became an awful lot harder to do so. You were feeling incredibly confused. You were having way too much trouble coming to realization that you dropped through an creepy hole full of creepy eyes and found yourself in the middle of Japan than you were earlier. Even ignoring the lack of sense it made, thinking back seemed an awful lot harder than it was earlier! The more you tried to remember, the more dizzy your head got. It was a toll just trying to remember your name!

"Hey!" speaking of which, Reimu got even more annoyed at you, "I just asked you a question! Who are you?!"

"Uh..." as soon as you uttered a syllable, you had trouble controlling your vision. The image of an angry young miko was blurring in and out like a camera with a broken iris. As you tried adjusting your focus, your head began to wobble because you suddenly became dizzy. You were a wreck.

"Um, excuse me?" you heard Reimu's voice echo in the blurred background, "what are you doing?"
Good question. What are you doing?! What's gotten into you?! Sadly, you couldnt answer that, because you had way too much difficult trying to remember anything. The only thing you could remember with no trouble was a voice. A young overly intrigued childlike voice...

"Dont worry, Mr Al-Ahmadr," you remember the voice saying, "His precious brain is fine. Just look at him. He's twitching with such anxiety. I bet he's having an extraordinary dream. I wish I could see what his dream looks like... when I do this.
That boy's voice... why does it scare you so? W...was he doing something with your brain?

"Hey, a-are you alright?" you heard Reimu's concerned echo which seemed distant, "Oh geez! Your head is bleeding!" It was too much. You were far too dizzy. It was a choir just standing. You needed to lie down bad. Lie down and rest. Sleep this really bad daze off. God youre so tired. So tired.

*Thud!*

"Mister? Mister?! Oh my god! Did he just pass out?! Oh no, what should I do?! Uh um... LADY HAKUREI! LADY HAKUREI!"

*******************

Some time later, you wake up...
11111.title: Letting the Daze Go By

111111.content:
..In the bed around the area you don't even know. You didn't know where you were then you saw two women sitting next to you. It was two females wearing some sort of red/white cloths. You remember one of them as reimu, but you don't know about the others.

"Are you ok? is everything under control?" Women asked.

"Um, yes. I'm ok now." You replied.

Both women and reimu sighed as they were glad you were ok. You wondered what happened to you, then reimu explained to you that you might had an brain hemorrhage so they called the doctor, but there were nothing wrong with the brain. You wondered how it happened and you wondered who that voice were. Just then other lady spoke.

"Well...I don't truly know who you are and the reason behind what's going on, but I do suggest you rest in our place for while." older lady spoke, "And as for the introduction.. you could call me sendai hakurei and the girl next to me is my successor, hakurei reimu."

You nodded to the two and thanked the two. Reimu told you she put some sort of unusual thing with window next to you. You looked to the side and noticed your galaxy phone next to you. You thanked them again and they left to do some chores. As they left, you thought for moment on what you should do now since you might be in the safe haven now. You could feel that the gangs would not chase you anymore since you were in this area, but you had one thing in your own mind: who was that voice in your mind? who was this 'al-ahmadr' person. As you rested, your phone suddenly rung and your heart jumped. You picked up the phone and looked at the screen and it wrote:

Best friend.

You felt skeptical on this but you had thoughts on picking up the phone. question is, will you?
111111.title: ...in a bed with two miko watching over you.

choices: Tell her you'd love to join her.
Tell her youre feeling up for it.
1111111.content:
'Best friend', eh? That's quite a bold nickname you'd give a contact. Youre not sure if this person is really your best friend or you just gave him that contact nickname as an irony (you really hope you didnt have that kind of sick sense of humor before you got amnesia!). Either way, you needed you know. You hope that this person calling really is a friend.

So you answer the phone.

You swallowed hard and carefully spoke, "H...hello?"

"Mike?! Mike, is that you?!" said a rather excited male voice on the other end, "GUYS! I got Mike on the phone!" You heard a lot of rustling and muttering in the background before the guy spoke again, "Thank god. We thought you were dead. What happened to you?!"
You felt nervous as you asked, "I'm... sorry. Who is this?"
"What do you mean who is this?" the guy sounded surprised that you asked, "you dont recognize my voice? It's me, Zane!" Zane. A slightly familiar name, but your mind is far too blurry to remember it.

"Z...Zane?"
"C'mon, Mike, we known each other since kindergarten!" Zane assures, "stop messing around. What's gotten into you?"
"I'm sorry," you shrugged your arms, "I cant for the life of me remember anything at the moment."
"What you talking ab-" Zane suddenly stopped talking and you heard whispering in the back, "... oh my god. No no, that's crazy. Michael's untouchable. There's no way he'd let Al-ahmadr do that to him!" ...Again with that name.
"Mike? Of course you remember me, right?" Zane asks like he's trying to deny the inevitable, "your old pal, Zane Rosewood, Detective of Paradiso County Police? I got our other pals Lydia, Ward, and Perez here too. Say Hi, guys!"
It's a good thing those guys could see the frown on you face when they all said hi. It felt really bad to forget something that important.

"Zane," you swallowed, "I dont remember them. I dont remember you, I dont remember anything."
You heard Zane sigh hard, "Damnit. What did that monster do to you? Ok ok, we'll worry about jogging your memory later. Where are you?"

You scanned around your surroundings. "I'm not really where exactly. It looks some kind of Shinto shrine in the middle of Japan. Two kind mikos here are letting me rest here."
"Japan? What are you doing all the way over there?" Zane groaned, "right, you dont remember. Nevermind, I'll run the phone tracker, give me a second."
"Ok," you patiently waited for him.
"What do you mean 'Location Unknown'?" you heard Zane remark, "you guys got a satellite orbiting the whole planet! Ugh, I knew I shoulda switched. Hang on, Mike, I got a plan B. Lydia, tap the phone!"
"Yes sir," you heard Lydia comply. It was then you realized far too late the little battery icon on the screen blinking red. The phone's almost dead!

"Alright, this might take a minute or so," your friend warned, "dont turn off the phone until we pinpoint you." You got a bit nervous looking at that warning icon. You might not have another minute or so to spare.

"Anything yet, Lydia?"
"Location Unknown," you heard her answer.
"Location Unknown?! Are you kidding?!" Zane became furious, "this is highly advanced 99.9% accurate technology youre using!"
"I'm... sorry sir," poor Lydia got nervous, "that's what it says."
"Forget it. Second time's a charm! Try it again!"

The warning icon was still blinking. Youre running out of time.
"Zane, my phone's almost dead," youre forced to tell him.
"WHAT?!" he shouted over the receiver, "Mike, I thought I told you several times to recharge your phone!" Oh crap, that was a bad habit of yours?"
"Uh, sorry?" was all you could say about it.
"Quick, hurry up and find a recharger!" he tells you, "Lydia's gonna get another reading soon."

You checked the window sill again. Fortunately, Reimu put the recharger next to the galaxy phone! Lucky break that you didnt lose it! ...BUT it wouldve have helped you anyway, because the room youre in lacked a single electrical outlet to plug it in. No lamps, tvs, radios, clocks, any of that stuff. Bad sign.

"Er, Zane..." you swallowed hard again, "I dont think this place has electricity."
"Hold that thought, Mike! Lydia, go faster! His phone's about to die!"
"I'm trying, sir!"
"Michael, stay with me! Just a minute longer and w-"

No response.

"Hello? Hello Zane?! HELLO?!" the phone's dead, "aw crap." Looks like you stranded with even more questions and even more people you dont remember worried for your sake. You sat down on the floor, rubbing your head trying to remember something else other than vague names and a creepy childlike voice commenting about your brain. But you couldnt do for long because all it ended up getting you was a slight headache.

Minutes after you gave up, the elder Hakurei came in through the sliding door with a hot cup of tea in her hands. She had smiled your as she placed it on the desk in front of you. Seeing the Miko's smile kinda lifted your spirits. Despite seeing a few scars on her face (and a couple on her exposed arms), it didnt do much to tarnish her natural beauty.

"How are you feeling?" she asked you.

"A little better, thank you," you gladly took the cup, "I remember my name, at least."
"What is it?" she was curious.
"Michael," you answered.

The elder Hakurei gave a hmph, " 'Michael'. Of what family?" You assume she asked what your last name is.
"That..." you lowered your head, "I still dont remember."

"Well, it's best not to rush it," she gave you a hint of encouragement, "it will come back to you in time. Now drink your tea before it gets cold."
"Thank you," you took slow sips of the tea. You assumed it was some sort of an herbal green tea. It wasnt bad, but coulda used a little honey.

"Uh... Lady Sendai Hakurei?"
"Yes?" she gave you her undivided attention.
"I need to make a call," you tell her.

"What kind of a call?" she asked you, "a bird call? A wolf call? ...Or perhaps a call to arms? I'm sorry, but we're peaceful shrine maidens." You looked at her oddly, then realized she got the 'call' wrong.
"No no no," you correct yourself, "I mean I need to use my phone. I think I can call up a friend of mine and left him know where I am, but the battery in it just died and I have to recharge it." As you talked, you noticed the Miko's smile getting a bit of a nervous twitch to it, like she's having a hard time comprehending what youre explaining to her.

"Call a friend... battery.... er, I'm sorry, could you please repeat that?" oh dear, it completely went over her head?!
"Um," you skip the unnnecessary explanation and just get to the point, "listen, do you have a place where I can plug in my phone?"

"Plug in.... phone?" she tilted her head questionably. Wow, this is TOTALLY going over her head!
You got a little worried, "Er, all I need is an electrical outlet. Is there an outlet around?"
"Out...let...?" she shook her and shrugged her arms, "is that some kind of noble city-slang?" OH CRAP. Where in the heck are you?!

You began to fear the worst as you asked one simple heart-pounding question. "Do you know what a lightbulb is?"
"Um..." she scratched the back of her head, "... a bulb... made of light?" OOOOHHH CRAP!! Not only do you have amnesia, youre in the middle of an unknown land without knowledge of modern technology! It seems like you didnt go back in time since apparently you still use your phone to contact people from the present, so where exactly is this place?!

"I'm sorry, Michael," Lady Sendai Hakurei blushed embarrassed, "Reimu is more savy when it comes to New World luxuries" NEW WORLD LU-urgghh! "but she's still in the middle of doing chores."
"Nah, dont worry about it," you stashed the phone in your pocket and figured you'd worry about it later. Right now, your mind is still in the recovery process. "Anyways, I have to thank you again for letting me stay here."
"It's no trouble," she said with conviction, "we havent gotten many visitors lately anyway. It might be because of the recent growth of monsters beyond these woods."
Your eyes widened, "Monsters?"
"Hopefully they'll migrate further west by the time the season's over," she says. Youre still stuck on the fact that monsters apparently exists here. WHERE THE HELL ARE YOU?!

"I think it's going to be a while until Reimu finishes her chores," Lady Hakurei states, "since there's free time, I'd better make the most of it training so I dont let my body get rusty." And what a body she had. She looked incredibly fit for a shrine maiden. Maybe she doubles as a martial artist, too. "If youre feeling better, perhaps you'd care to join me? Maybe it'll help improve your mind as well as your body."
1111111.title: Like Robonson Crusoe, as primitive as can be!

choices: grey haired man with glasses and merchant cloth
11111111.content:
You felt that now that you heard something about the monsters beyond the hakurei shrine, you felt you might need to hone your strength so you could defend yourself. You decided then turned to the sendai miko.

"Sure, once I'm better I'll come along with you." You said.

"That is wonderful." Sendai replied.

Just then, both you and sendai saw reimu coming in. She told her about what you have said and she thought for moment, then she turned her attention to you.

"I kinda know." Reimu said, "Maybe we should go see Rinnosuke-san about this." Reimu said.

You didn't know who this rinnosuke and spoke up.

"Who's this rinnosuke person?" You asked.

"He's the shop owner who knows a lot about the outside world." Reimu replied.

You thought to yourself 'outside world?' but for now you had some sort of relief that this rinnosuke person might have something to back you up with the phone. You thanked her and reimu nodded, turning to the sendai to ask where the rags so she could start cleaning the storage area. Sendai told her where it was and she left the scene. Sendai miko got up, telling you she'll start her training and parted way with you. You layed back, thinking about this zane person and others and shifted position.

"Zane...who are you?" You muttered.

You then relaxed your day.

-underground-

Deep within the underground district, a vortex opened, revealing a person in traditional Saudi cloth getting out. He was carrying the sword with him and once he walked west for while, he found the abandoned temple before him. The temple were like the Shinto shrine, but it was so old it showed it age. The Saudi man walked toward the temple and saw the seal in front of the door. He put his right arm In front of the seal and spoke one thing in Arabic. The seal then bursted in flames and before the man opened the door, he heard someone shouting stop. He turned around and saw a pink haired girl standing before the temple.

"You shall not free that demon within." Girl said.

The Saudi man was silent and then smiled. He snapped his finger and from behind her two mens appeared and captured her. The Saudi man continued to smile and spoke to her.

"I am only using this...demon for the sake of others, young friend." Man said.

He then turned around and opened the door completely. The pink haired girl shouted 'no!' and Three object came out. One had the white haired oni mask, one was samurai armor which had some sort of Sanskrit on it, and a katana that radiates evil. The man turned back to the pink haired girl with smile while the object floated around.

"Unfortunately, the great demon lord would rather possess a youkai rather then human." Saudi man said, "Unfortunate, really. You'll be an honorary vessel for the one."

"No..No!" Girl spoke.

He was about to take the artifact to the girl until he noticed the things were gone. He turned back to see the green haired girl with black hair got it. The Saudi man were surprised to see this as the green haired girl observed the mask.

"Woow, I can sense the evil within! What is this!?" Girl asked.

"No! koishi! get away!!" Girl shouted.

The mask then suddenly got to her face. Koishi struggled but with no luck as she tried to use her ability but then her strength went away, making the armor and katana surround her. The Saudi man gleed and then rose his arms.

"The resurrection of demon is now complete! now it will do what I say!!" man said.

Body of koishi grew more and more until it was the mans size. The person looked at the Saudi man and then petted his shoulder.

"It seems.... you have released me..." Voice spoke.

"Yes. I need your strength to make chaos in this land!" Man said, "Then taking over it!"

The voice just scoffed and then both man and the person walked. Man told the mens to kill the pink haired girl, and they pushed the girl and shot many time at her. The girl thought she was going to die but a gap opened, letting her in and closed. The Saudi man tilted his head and then made 'tch' noise.

"Sir. Is everything ok?" Man said.

"My power is too weak, but it will rise." Person spoke.

"Good... now we shall take the first step." Saudi man said.

He and the person that was koishi walked toward the city.

-overworld-

You were outside waiting for reimu to finish up what she was doing so you and reimu could go meet this rinnosuke person. Reimu came and once you two were ready, you two bid farewell to sendai and walked. Through the forest, it was was quiet and peaceful and within hour, you two reached the store. The outside looked messy as there were many things on display. Once you looked up you saw the sign that wrote 'kourindou' on it. You knew little of Japanese but you didn't understand fully.

"Let's go in, mike." Reimu said.

"Yeah, sure." You replied.

Once you got in, you two were greeted by....
11111111.title: Tell her you'd love to join her.

111111111.content:
At the counter stood a grey haired man with oriental merchant style clothes with a nap sack at his front wearing glasses over a pair of eerie yellow eyes. You noticed feral animal-like slanted pupils in those yellow eyes, giving subtle hints that this guy aint entirely human. But with your current state of mind, as long as he aint lunging for your throat, it didnt bother you any.

You stared silently at him for a short period of time however, just making sure that it would remain that way. Though your memory was a blur, you vaguely remember having that kind of instinctual reaction toward peculiar kinds of strangers. Perhaps you've had a lot of bad run-ins with those kinds?

"Hi Rinnosuke!" Reimu on the other hand cheerfully greeted the suspicious man with a childlike grin to match her enthusiasm.

"Reimu," Rinnosuke said to your caretaker, "youre awful early today. I dont have any new wares. And it's fair to warn you I put up some special wards so if your little friend tries to steal something, she will be electrocuted." Electrocuted?!
"Nah, that's alright, Rinnosuke. Marissa's not here today," Reimu replies casually, "actually, I'm here cuz Hakurei Shrine's new star tourist needs some help." New star tourist? "This is Michael. Our foreign customer."
"A foreigner eh?" Rinnosuke observed you with interest, "guten abend! Ich heisse Rinnosuke. Das Eigentümer von Kourindou, die antiquitätenshop!"
You stared blankly at him, "...Huh?"
Rinnosuke tilted his head, slightly baffled then turned to Reimu, "the foreigner's not a German?"
"I think he's one of those Eastern European snow gaijins," Reimu's theory left you awful puzzled.
"Oh. Well, I'm sorry. I dont speak Russian," Rinnosuke as you mouthed 'Snow gaijins?' with a dumbfounded look on your face, "anyways, what can I do for you, foreign traveler?"

"Michael's got amnesia," Reimu answered for you, "he says he cant really remember much.”
“Ah, I'm sorry, Reimu,” Rinnosuke apologized, “I'm afraid I sold all my memory-boosting herbs to that rabbit from Eientei. But she traded them for these special blue raspberry-flavored pills. Not sure what they do, but theyre on sell if youre interested.” Uh… is that even legal?

“No way!” Reimu shook her head adamantly, “last time we bought some of your pills, Marissa's boobs expanded to the size of watermelons and she couldnt walk for a week!” You really shouldnt be hearing this!

“Actually, what I need at the moment is a charger,” you speak to the shopkeep, “my, er, phone is out of battery and I need to charge it with something. Do you have anything that can connect to this?” You pull out your phone and hand it to Rinnosuke.
Rinnosuke carefully observes the phone like he's practically mindblown by what it is. You really hoped he was more informed on technology than Lady Hakurei was.
“Hm… what exactly is this again?” your heart sank a little when he asked but you kept calm and answered.
“It's a smart phone. It allows someone to make telephone calls nearly anywhere without the necessity of plugging into a phone jack.”
“Ok, phone, PHONE! I know what THAT is,” he cuts you off, “the problem is you currently cant make any phone calls with it?”
“It has no power,” you explain, “it runs on a battery but the battery used up all it's juice and needs to recharge.”
“Hm,” the shopkeep stares for another few seconds before finally opening a drawer, “well, if it's an electrical cord youre looking for, so far, all I have currently are these.” He opens a drawer and shows off a bunch of power cords, extension cords, phonejacks all jammed into that one single drawer with discount tags tied to each one. “Do you think any of these might work?”

You looked through the drawer. Tons of different cords meant for a variety of electrical appliances from digital clocks to laptop chargers… sadly, none that match your phone.
“No,” you answer, “the cord has to have an end that plugs into this shape.” You show him the port that the charger plugs in.
“Well, sorry I couldnt help you,” Rinnosuke shrugs his shoulders, “maybe that engineer girl down at the ravine could build something that'll help you out. Dont expect her to do it for cheap though!”
“Sorry, Mike. The shrine is on an air tight budget,” explained Reimu, “we cant afford Nitori's outrageously overpriced junk at the moment.”
“I understand. I dont wanna be a major burden on you.” Well, looks like that Zane guy will have to wait even longer. You cant help but wonder what he's doing right now. He and your other pals must be worried half to death about you! Maybe later, you could think of some way to 'barter' with this Nitori person?

“Oh! That reminds me!” Reimu suddenly beamed as she turned to Rinnosuke, “did you finally fix those arcades yet! I got my bag of coins here with me!”
“As a matter of fact I have,” he said with an assured grin, “turns out it was nothing a few good discounted extension cords couldnt fix.”
“AWESOME!” she shouted with glee as she dashed toward one of the arcades! She stuck into a coin in the first machine she saw, which was Pac-Man, and her eyes were glued unblinkingly to the screen.

So she played. And she played. Until she got sick of Pac-Man. Then she went on to play Street Fighter II. And played. And played. And played and played and played, getting incredibly frustrated because she couldnt beat M. Bison (or Vega, since she'd technically be playing the Japanese version for obvious reasons, right?).

“Uh, Reimu? Shouldnt we be going now? We've been here long enough.”
“When I'm done, when I'm done,” she didnt even turn her head away from the screen. She still kept focused, still hammering on the buttons, still pumping coins into the machine.

“Sorry about Reimu,” Rinnosuke whispered, “there's hardly ever a day she comes to my shop and pass up the arcades ever since I put them in. It was a financial gambit I do not regret taking!” He laughed… then he noticed you werent laughing with him, so he stopped. “Listen, if you wanna talk to Nitori, her ravine isnt that far from here. It's only about half a kilometer west of here. If you hear the sound of running water youre on the right track.”

You think about it as you look over at Reimu, now glued to the Marvel Vs Capcom arcade. This was gonna take a while. You could be over at the ravine then come right back and she'd probably never notice you were gone!

“Just make sure you dont stay out after dark,” Rinnosuke warns, “the forest is for the most part safe for humans, but at night… well the crazies come out and… well, some crazy youkai like to take advantage of lonely humans lost in the woods.”
Damnit. You shoulda stayed and meditated with the Miko! Despite her lack of knowledge in modern technology, you were in much better hands with her than her pupil or little sister or daughter or niece or whatever the hell the relation is!

Before you could mentally rant any more, you hear the desperation in Zane's voice in your mind again just before your phone died. You needed answers. He was the guy to get them from. But you have no idea where he is and he has no idea where on earth you are. Maybe if you can find this Nitori person, you can work something out and get in contact with him again.
Of course, that's provided you can before night time. Then Zane and the others might have even more to stress about...
111111111.title: The Bizarre Bazaar

1111111112.content:
You decided to go to ravine by yourself due to frustration. You got out of Rinnosukes house and walked toward the place but you didn’t know where it was but you trusted your instincts to follow yourself toward the ravine. As the ground turned little pale and rocky, you felt like like something was up to no good until someone came to you. It was a short black haired girl with white shirt and black skirt and had a red hat on her head.

“Ayayaya~a human walking alone here?” Girl spoke.

“Who-who’re you?” You asked.

“I’m pure and honest Aya Shameimaru! A crow Tengu! And now for a quick quick flash!” She responded.

She took out an camera and started to take a snapshot of you! You told her to stop, but with her agility, she is too quick to to be stopped for you to make to be stopped.

“Stop...stop! Please stop!” You demanded.

“Ayayaya~what if I say no, huh?” Aya mocks you.

Just then...
1111111112.title: enter Camera girl.

choices: Just then, the two of them bump into Aya!
11111111121.content:
Just when the annoying crow-girl was about to take half a dozen more pictures of you and then kidnap you and introduce you to her lonely friend Hatate, the two of you overheard a loud buzzing sound.

"Huh?" Aya stopped blinding you with her extremely high-flash camera and turned her direction of the noise.... aka, a large swarm of angry killer bees which quickly swarmed at her!

"EEEEEEKKKK!!!" she let out a high-pitched shriek as she desperately attempted to swat them away to no avail! With no other option, the crow girl flew away in retreating, screaming off the top of her lungs as she left!

*Beep beep!*
Suddenly, a blue haired girl in a blue dress and a green cap emerged from the bushes and pressed buttons on a little remote. Immediately after, the angry swarm of killer bees descended on her!
...Well, actually they descended on the box she had in her hand which they immediately flew in. and with another push of the button, the buzzing came to an immediate stop. Remote control bees?

"Dumb crow. That'll teach you to scare away my customers," you heard her mumble. Something tells you she has a history with that Aya girl. But now wasnt the time. Blue hair already turned your direction.

"Sorry about that moron," she apologizes, "I assure you she does not represent nor does she have affiliation whatsoever with Genbu Ravine!" Ravine, she says? Is THAT the ravine Rinnosuke was talking about?
"Er... thanks?" you scratched your head, still a little dumbfounded by the surprise OCD paparazzi!

"Still, humans shouldnt be wandering around these woods all alone," the blue haired girl lectures, "quite a lot of dangerous youkai prowl around here looking for easy prey." Just as Rinnosuke warned.
"Was uh, SHE dangerous?" you asked.
She sighed, "No. Just irritable. Anyways what are you doing out here by yourself?"

"I'm looking for a girl named Nitori," you answered, "heard she might be able to charge the power of my phone. Nobody else apparently can?"
"I'M Nitori!" she proudly exclaims, "just need something to charge your phone? That'll be no trouble for me! Quick, come this way before anybody else sees you!"
"Ok," like a gullible fool, you blindly follow along this girl, blindly relying on fate that youre in good hands... but it's either depend on the kindness of strangers or continue wandering lost in the woods by yourself. And you'd rather not risk bumping into someone more dangerous than an annoying girl with a camera!

******************

Even more time passes as Reimu is STILL at Rinnosuke's shop, STILL wasting her time and coins on his arcade! Rinnosuke shoulda questioned that she has some sort of a dangerous gaming addition, but as long as she keeps pouring money into his machine, he's not gonna let it bother him whatsoever!

However, somebody else is bothered by the fact that somebody hasnt returned to the shrine by now. In walks the head Miko of Hakurei Shrine, worried about her pupil's (and perhaps daughter's?) long absence. A quick greeting and question later, the shopkeep points over to the direction of Reimu, eyes still glued to the arcade screen.

"Reimu?"

*GASP!* Reimu gasped the microsecond she heard Lady Hakurei's unforgettable voice call out by her name! She immediately stops what she's doing, letting the Sinistar devour her ship, and obediently turns to her mentor's direction!
"L-Lady Hakurei!"

"Reimu, was this seriously what you've been doing the whole time?!" Sendai scolds her, "You've just skipped out on your whole daily duty for that silly game?!"
"I'm tremendously sorry, Lady Hakurei," she bows apologetically, "I've given into temptation! I wont let it happen again! I swear!"
Sendai sighs and shakes her head, "We'll discuss this later, right now it's getting really late. Where's Michael?"

Sure enough, the young miko's eyes widened.
"Uh, Michael?"

"Yes, you were with him last. Where is he?"
Reimu's eyes darted around the place. In all the time she spent glued to the arcade, she completely lost track of him! If he told her where he was going, she obviously wasnt listening!
"Uhhhhh.... um.... hm...."
Sendai was getting impatient, "Reimu, it's a simple question. Where is he?" A simple question Reimu did not have the answer to.

And unfortunately for her, Rinnosuke did.

"Uh, Lady Hakurei," he spoke up, "last I remember, he was asking about a replacement phone charger. When we didnt have one, I merely suggested that the kappa at the ravine might have something to charge his phone, so..." Sendai's nostrils flared. That was all she needed to hear!

"You let a human in need suffering from amnesia wander off into the woods alone?!!" she vented her frustration toward her pupils direction.
"N-no! H-h-he just wandered off without my saying so!" she pleaded, "h-h-had I known, I wouldve never let him go off on his own!"
"Reimu! Do you have any idea what will happen to our shrine if words gets out we abandoned a helpless human in need that was already in our care?!"
"D-D-Dont worry, Lady Hakurei! I'll find him! I promise!"
"WE will find him!" Sendai grabs Reimu's arm and drags her out of the shop, "and after that, we're gonna have a LONG talk!"
"Y-yes ma'a-Ow!! Hey, that hurt!"
"Trust me, that pain's gonna pale in comparison to later, now get moving!"

1111111112112.content:
"Nitori? Nitori?" suddenly, you hear a voice calling from upstairs. Then you hear the sound of the basement door opening followed by footsteps.

Immediately recognizing the voice, she turns to you and whispers, "Quick! Hide!"
"Why? Who is it?" you asked.
"A youkai, now hurry and hide!" without even much thought let alone objection, she quickly shoved you into a nearby closet! You didnt even get time to grab your charger, let alone new sword and gun! Thankfully, it had airholes-I mean gaps to see through to the outside. And shortly after being crammed in the closet, you spotted another girl barging into the basement. A pointy-earred brunette wearing a hat similar to that Aya girl, only her hair was in purple bowed pigtails and she wore a purple and black checkered skirt. Another 'Tengu' if that's what Aya called it?

"H-Hi Hatate!" Nitori greeted this girl, "what can I do for you today?"
That Hatate girl sighs in disappointment like this wasnt her first time, "Aya ran a fowl of some angry bees again. You got any more of your special anti-venom?" Those artificial bees had venom in them?!
Nitori grins nervously, "Heh heh, honestly what is it with that girl and bees? Does she desperately want to get herself some free honey THAT badly?"
Hatate shrugs her shoulders, "I dunno. She surprises me sometimes. So do you have any more anti-venom."
"Sure, hang on," Nitori heads to a cabinet and pulls out a little marked vial bottle.
"Thanks," Hatate takes the bottle and hands Nitori some unreadable bills.
"Pleasure doing business with you," the blue-haired salesperson smiled, "will there be anything else?"

"W...well... there is.... one last thing."

Through one of the gaps, you can make out Hatate sweating profusely as she was glancing each and every direction. Something told you she was really really uncomfortable about what she was about to ask.

"Well, what is it?" Nitori asked.

"Do you... um... still have... any more of those uh.... toys?" the Tengu girl felt really really awful after asking that.
“I got all kinds of toys,” Nitori needed specifics, “you have something in mind?”
“Er, y-yeah...” Hatate stuttered, “y-yknow, one of those… THOSE… kind of toys?”
Nitori tilted her head, “What kind of toys?”
“Uh, the kinds… for.. uh… THAT kind of stress relief.”
“I got about a dozen stress balls if that's what youre looking for.”
“No no no no NO!” Hatate groans with embarrassment, “...I'm talking about… uh… the ones that… go in… me.” She was gesturing her arm upwards toward between her legs. Thankfully your amnesia was still strong enough to miss what she's referring to there, otherwise you'd be groaning with disgust!

“Oh. OOOOOH!!!” but Nitori finally gets it, “one of THOSE, huh? Heh, sorry Hatate. I did make a few… to SELL of course.. but a couple of girls came by the other day and bought the last ones I had.”
But the Tengu girl wasnt ready to give up, “W-well do you have anything that matches the size and shape at least?”
“Not unless you wanna blast your ovaries out!” Again, thank you amnesia!
“Then cant you make something that'll suffice? Like an android guy or something?”
“That'll take months of building, weeks of glitch testing, and tons of cash I know you dont have!”
“THEN MAKE ME A BLOWUP GUY! I DONT CARE! GIVE ME SOMETHING!!” Hatate was beginning to get pretty angry and pretty desperate! You felt a little sorry for her. You wish there was some way you could help.

“Sheesh, get a hold of yourself, girl!” Nitori ripped herself away from her.
“That's the problem! I CANT!” Hatate remarked, “my special season came early and my dealer told me she suffered a medicine shortage. And I cant concentrate on doing my job and providing for my well being if part of me is too busy craving!! And that smell in this room isnt helping… wait a second!” She started sniffing across the room, “that… smell…”
“What smell?” Nitori asked.
“*Sniff sniff*” Hatate sniffed, “THAT… smell… *sniff*… it smells so… *sniff*… masculine… *sniff*… and inviting...” her cheeks went red as she continued to sniff the air, “...and untouched.” You tried sniffing around for whatever she's sniffing, but couldnt smell anything!

“How much you want for it?!!!”
“For what?”
“Whatever's smelling like that!! Hurry up and sell it to me!!” Hatate demanded.
“I dont smell anything.”
“C'mon! I know you have something that's smelling that fragrant! Name your price!”
“I honestly dont have anything like that,” Nitori tells her.

You could see the tears running down Hatate's face as she gritted her teeth and trembled. She seriously looked like she was in absolute agony. It kinda triggered your chivalrous side. You felt guilty just staring over there and ignoring a poor girl in need. Had it not been for the amnesia, you'd probably know WHY she's feeling that way and why you SHOULDNT volunteer to help!

Anyways, you wondered if you might have something to offer her that could ease whatever is stressing her out. Surely, you could do something, ANYTHING to help her out!
But just as you were about to come out of the closet, some iffy, fuzzy part of your brain was giving off a bad warning. Like a red-flag was triggering but you dont know why. Was it seriously THAT big a deal to help out poor little Hatate?

You lean on the side of the shrine wall and thought about those mafia goons who tried to killed you. You wanted to get back at them, even if you are alone.

"You're still want payback?" Reimu ask as you nod. "What's the point, they think you're dead and it's not like they're all over Gensokyo."

"Hmph, I guess you do have a point." You replied. "But still... if I do come across those guys again, I gave them a beating they won't forget."

The shrine maiden sat down on the floor and started drinking tea. You have the feeling that she's waiting for someone, so you continue to stand there and be on the watchout. You couldn't stop thinking about that 'thing' that Reimu was about to give when you ran off earlier, it is some sort of tool? A weapon maybe? After about a couple of minutes the two of you saw someone coming.

Who was it?

1112.content:
You were slowly getting up from the dizziness and unconsciousness as you got up, you shook your head and opened your eyes and realizing that you were no longer in the street and the dead end that you were running away from the mafia that was trying to kill you. You thought that maybe you were in the mountain area but it will take at least an hour to get to the nearest mountain, and you were in the city so you didn't know where you exactly were.

You got off from the ground and looked around knowing that this area was not safe. You started to walk as you saw a dirt road you started to walk through the lane. Just then, you noticed an open area and got out of the forest. You quickly saw a house not too far from the place and you walked toward it. Once you got to the front door, you knocked on the front door but with no answer. You knocked on the door again but nobody answered the front.

"Hello!? Anybody home!?" You spoke.

You sighed as the sun was starting to set, you grabbed the knob only to realize that it was unlocked. You felt uneasy as you never were an home intruder or something but it was starting to get dark so you went into the house. Once you got inside the area was.....

It directly hit his right shoulder and he fell, wounded and the two catched him up. The defector saw them and the other grunt took out the colt .45 revolver and pointed at him.

"Good night, you little brat!" Grunt said.

Just as he was going to shoot, the defector heard a gunshot and saw the two grunts shot dead then bursted in flame. they fell back to their death, the defectors vision became blurry as he saw two people walked to him. One picked him up and saw a vision of long white haired women with red/white ribbon and other a short light brown haired women in good suite and a desert eagle on her right hand.

"big...sis?" defector spoke softly.

"Don't get up yet young man. You're not completly healed yet." Women said.

The lady took the board with few papers, written some words and then put it on her table.

You and your sister didn't meet each other until you graduated highschool that she was part of the gang. You then had the confidence that it was your sister. Eirin then took out the syringe gave you a shot. You felt sick but at least you were alive. Just then, a women in bunny ears came in and walked next to eirin.
