1113322222221121221.content:
Two figures before stick out in your mind like the holes in Adalgar's chest and the look on Yoshika's face right before she sank her teeth into you. One figure was of course, God have mercy, that same Jiangshi earlier that devoured you as well as swallowed your former co-worker's infected arm and puked it back out in front of you. You scooted up closer to Adalgar on instinct before you turned your attention to the 2nd figure. Beside Yoshika was a young blue haired woman worn in some sort of oriental loops entwined with a long hair stick, wearing a somewhat elegant blue dress and it seems like there's a transparent white ribbon hovering around her.

NO, SERIOUSLY. The ribbon does not even look like it's touching her, it's literally hovering around her! Neato trick, but nothing truly compares to witnessing and becoming part of the undead.
Ignoring Yoshika's creepy stare of way too much intrigue, her friend seems to be giving you some sort of disapproving frown. The last time you were given a frown like that was when your mom found out where you've been going every Sunday after midnight!

“Kaku-sama,” Adalgar gave a humble bow to the woman, “this is the former associate of mine I've told you about.”
You felt nothing but bad vibes coming from that disapproving frown on her.

“Oh yes,” she stared your way, “so this is the stubborn heretic that… spoiled my servant's dinner.” Yoshika lowered her head with shame and you ignored the loud cracks you heard from her neck when she did that!
“It's an honor to meet you,” you try to act polite despite feeling a little offended she called you a 'stubborn heretic'. Unlike Adalgar, you didnt bow because… well, you dont bow.

Yoshika's boss took a couple steps toward you and held the cross around your neck in her hands and observed it.
“For a newcomer, this is awful bold of you,” she commented, “your first day of being welcomed in our temple and youre casually wearing symbols of idol worship.”
“It's not idol worship,” you took the cross back and corrected her, “it's what I am.”

“Ssss!” Yoshika sucked in some air and stepped back.

“Kaku-sama, please excuse my associate,” Adalgar had to step in and defuse whatever s-storm you may have caused, “he may speak a bit too freely at times, but I assure you he is very loyal to those he owes favors to. Plus, his stubbornness means he wont be influenced by the Buddhists.” Buddhists?
“Plus his meaty bits are REALLY good, Seiga!” the damn zombie remarked, “you should try them, theyre like New York Strip!”

Ms. Kaku sighed, “Well, I suppose his stubbornness will come in handy. Byakuren's toadies are becoming more and more resourceful. Still, should you consider renouncing that heresy and accepting the grace and harmony of pure Taoism, there would be many doors open for you in your future.” Too bad for her, your faith is not something to willing to bargain!

“Sorry,” you humbly decline, “but that will honestly not happen.”

“So you say now,” this woman seems awful full of herself, “anyways newcomer, as long as youre staying here, you are free to display your symbols of idolatry in private, but publicly, ESPECIALLY during a sermon, you are to conceal them.” Again, her calling your favorite keepsake idolatry is rubbing you the wrong way, but Adalgar, a CANAANITE, nodded your way.
“I'm sorry if my Lord and Savior offends you,” you take the necklace off and put it in your pocket, “I dont think we've been properly introduced, Lady Kaku. I'm-”
“First of all, if youre going to stay here, you need to learn the proper way to address someone,” she interrupts you, “you do not address me as 'Lady Kaku'. It's 'Kaku-sama'.”
You stare coldly but answer, “My apologies, Kaku-sama.”
“That's better,” Seiga is pleased, “secondly, whatever your name was while you were alive no longer applies here. Since it was MY servant that has granted you this state, it's only fair that I give you your name.” You raised your eyebrow as she thought, “Hm… ah! Alright, seeing as though youre CURRENTLY a believer of the wrong faith, I think the name of a saint of the wrong faith is proper!” Oh dear. “From now on, you will be known as Shiro Amakusa!”

You blinked at the name. You'll probably have to look up who this 'Shiro Amakusa' fellow is before you could give your opinion on it. That is if youre ever given the opportunity. Regardless, it's gonna take some getting used to. Not to mention, you wonder what Adalgar's new name is. And how many does that make it?

“I trust there's no objection to the name?”

“Not at all, Kaku-sama,” you tell her, “Shiro is fine.”

“Good,” Seiga is once again pleased, “we'll go over some more of the rules after the Miko's sermon is over. Canaanite, we need to have a word in private. Yoshika, kindly find Shiro a place in the crowd to sit.” Again you began to shiver! It's almost as if Seiga's purposely doing this to you for not converting!
The jiangshi's back cracked loudly when she bowed. “You got it, Seiga! C'mon, Shoru!”
“SHIRO!” Seiga corrected her.

It was a bit unnerving being so close to this ghoul that just moments ago tore into you in a mixture of hunger and gleeful sadism. Considering she clearly enjoyed your taste, who's to say she wont try it again later? Can you trust the caretakers of this place to prevent such a thing from happening?
And that's not even counting that horrible smell of hers that's currently still torturing your nostr-

...Wait. Where's the awful smell? Sure, you can smell a little too much perfume off her, but not the nauseating decay that it failed to mask! Come to think of it, you dont even remember breathing in her odor when she was eating Adalgar's arm!
You leaned in way too close to see if you can smell that decaying odor, but you couldnt! Just too much perfume!

“Hm?” oops, Yoshika noticed, “what's wrong, Shardo?”
“How come you dont reek anymore?” you tactlessly ask.
“Huh?” she tilted her cracking head as she frowned at you. She even leaned down and smelled her armpit, then shrugged her shoulders. Oh dear lord, her face doesnt even look as… cadaverous as it used to! You actually think it looks kinda cute… for a pale dead chick.

“Er, anyway! How much further?” you asked.
“To where?” was she serious?
“To the sermon!” you answered.
“...Uhhhhhhh...OH! Oh right, right!” good lord, she's STILL brain-dead, “Whoopsie!” and she quickly turned around and headed the opposite direction, wasting plenty of time! Well, at least if she tries to eat you again, you can always outsmart her.

After a pointlessly long walk in the wrong direction followed by what hoped to be a long walk in the RIGHT direction, the both of you finally reach the ceremonial room...

1113322222221121221122.title: to bath

choices: Tell her she forgot to put her clothes back on...
11133222222211212211222.content:
You squinted your eyes at a little stone statue floating in the water. Peeking your interest, you lean in closer to it and observe it. It looked to be a sculpture of a man with the head of a bull sitting in an alter with his hands extended out for something. You remember seeing pictures of similar depictions in church during a sermon. That sermon involved the wars between the Israelites and Caananites. During that sermon, you remember seeing that depiction when Pastor Sergios was bringing up child sacrifice. That's when it hits you!

That little idol is a baby sacrificial altar to Molech!

You cringed in disgust, inadvertently activating your powers causing the little figure to decay before you tossed that damn thing as far as you could throw it! Ugh! You felt so dirty just holding on to that disgusting thing!

"HEY!! That was mine!!"

And speaking of dirty and disgusting, you hear Yoshika's voice scream out at you! You turned and flinch at the now naked jiangshi standing stiff before you with anger! How did she manage to sneak up on you, why is she naked, and how was it that you werent able to smell her coming?!
"That was a gift from Ratty!" she scolded you with her arms still sticking out, "how dare you just chuck it out like trash!"

You quickly turn away with a blush, trying not to stare at her exposed breasts and remind your friend downstairs she's still a filthy zombie!

"W-w-what are you doing here?!" you questioned.
"DUUUUH!" she gave you a sarcastic 'duh', "I'm trying to get clean!"
"B-but youre dead... I-I-I mean I'M already using the bath, so why are you in here?!"
"I dont know why YOURE here," she looked as though you asked a dumb question, "but this is MY bath time! I'm scheduled to take my bath at 9pm, didnt you look at the schedule?!"
"But... it's 8pm," you looked at your watch and corrected her.
Her neck cracked when she tilted it questionable, "It is?" you showed her your watch, "....OOOH!! Right right! I forgot. It's not daylight saving's time anymore!" It hasnt been daylight saving's time for a couple months! But instead, she just shrugs her shoulders, "Ya know what? I'm already here and I got my things ready, so I'm just gonna finish my bath!" You had a feeling there'd be point arguing with this idiot, so you decided to just bathe with her. Besides, maybe she knows how to use the bath kits.

"Well, uh, since youre here," you look to her with your hand covering the visual area where her chest is, "could ya tell me how to use one of these bath kits?"

"Eh, I dont bother with them," Yoshika said, "those things wear out your skin, anyways." Ironic. "I used my own body wash. It not only cleans good, it's great on my sensitive skin. Keeps it really alive and healthy!" More irony. But in her defense, her skin does look well preserved for a dead chick. "I'll share some with you if you pass me a sponge."

"Er, thanks," against your better judgement you grab two sponges, one for you and one for her, and she gets out her bottle of body wash and squirts some in both sponges. "Um... can you even move your arms?"

"Of course. Why?" Yoshika asks as you hear the loud cracks of her frozen joints as she rubs her sponge against her body!
"N-No reason!!" you quickly turn away, but those disgusting cracks her joints were making were loud! Even while being partially disgusted, part of you was fighting off the scandalous mental image of a naked Yoshika washing her body right behind you! You tell yourself she's a foul smelling zombie, but she aint a bad looking foul smelling zombie! And lord knows how old she is and how long she's been a rotting corpse. Maybe it is the body wash she's using. Maybe if you start using some, your body wont be rotting and decaying so fast, either. That way of thinking did make you less reluctant to rub Yoshika's body wash on your own body. It kinda smells like oatmeal, too. You like oatmeal.

"Hey uh, could ya do my back?" suddenly, Yoshika gave you a request, "I cant really reach it." You looked to see Yoshika already had her back turned to you! You got a bit nervous and looked down your friend downstairs (while covering the visual area where her naked ass is!) and whispered 'NO!' to it.
"S-sure!" you reluctantly agreed, "it's the least I can do for letting me borrow your body wash!" Your hands shivered, worried you'd get sick just by touching her back! Somehow it didnt take long for you to get over that feeling, cuz you had no trouble scrubbing her back with your sponge. Even in close inspection, she not only didnt smell bad, her skin, despite being dead pale, did look rather lively.

"Hey, Yoshika?"

"Yeah?"

"I'm curious," you say, "how did you die?"
"Huh?"
"I mean back before you became a jiangshi," you added, "how did you die?"
"....Uhhhhhh..." she was probably rolling her eyes in deep thought, "I dunno."
"You dont know?"
"I uh, cant remember," she answered, "I cant even think that far back."
"Do you remember at least anything about your past life?" you questioned.
"Nope," she shook her head (you ignore the small snaps in her neck), "last thing I remember is waking up in this big deep hole and Seiga asking me if I wanted to convert and I said yes." Dang. That's all she remembers? Bummer. Either her brain is that rotten or it's been an awful long time. "Oh! By the way! Seiga told me to ask you to convert, too." Ugh. Shouldve expected those damn taoists to be stubborn.
You groaned and responded, "Tell her I said no."
"Ok." And that was the end of it. Shouldnt have expected much from good ol' Yoshika.

Shortly after that conversation ended, so did the bath.

"Whelp! Thanks for lending me a hand!" Yoshika thanked you.
Your blushed a little and returned the thanks, "Thanks for lending me one too!"
"I hope I forget the time tomorrow so we can bathe together again!" you couldnt believe Yoshika just said that. You also cant believe how interested you were!
You blushed again, "Well... we'll see!"

With that, the naked jiangshi huddled over to her pile of clothes then over to the little Molech statue.
"There you are, widdle Mowech! Did da big scawy hewatic hurt you? Dunt wowwy! Mommy's here now!"
*CraaaaaaAACCK!* her hips let out a long crack when she bent over to pick it up! Again you turn your head and tell your friend downstairs to stop doing what it's doing! Finally with her adorable little symbol of child sacrifice clenched in her hand, she waltzed out of the baths... forgetting to put her clothes back on first!
"And I actually let her chew me to death?" you whispered to yourself as you put YOUR clothes back on!

And soon as you stepped out, Yoshika was standing outside of there waiting for you... you felt so wrong part of you was glad she STILL didnt put her clothes back on!

"Hey, if ya aint busy," Yoshika casually spoke with her statue AND clothes still in her hand, "you feel like hanging out? Seiga said there's gonna be this awesome eclipse happening outside!" You fought off the disturbing thought of her going outside in the buff to see it!
Well, despite killing you, she has been pretty nice so far... nicer than certain OTHER inhabitants of this place, anyway!

"Sure," you happily oblige, trying not to stare, "but uh, first you-" On second thought, part of you kinda wants to see how far she's gonna go without noticing she's still naked! You know she's pretty dumb, but part of you wants to know just how dumb! Yeah, that's it! Just a joke! Absolutely NOT perverted in any way! C'mon, she's a zombie for Christ's sake!

"Uh, but first what?" Yoshika asks with tilted her head with a snap.

1113322222221121221122222.title: hovering dead

11133222222211212211222221.content:
His warning was duly noted. Though your curiosity sparked now that you overheard this mysterious woman knows about a recently dead now somewhat resurrected guy and came here of all places related to such purpose. Does she know about you? Does she know anything about your predicament?
But nonetheless, if even Adalgar is intimidated by her, she's not someone you wanna approach. Not yet anyway.

"Is there anything you need to tell me about this woman?" you question your old comrade, "this Yuki something?"
"It's YUKARI," he corrects you, "she has no tolerance for anything that cant get her name right. Ba'al help you if she heard you mispronounce it like that."
"Alright," you brush off the warning like the naive sucker you are, "anything else?"
"Dont bother learning anything else," he insists, "except maybe to be extremely careful talking about her. EVER. Even in secret. There is NO place on the planet that's too secret for her."
"What do you mean?"
"You know that conspiracy theory about the government spying on you 24/7 no matter where you are?" he asks, "she actually HAS that ability."
"What?"
"That's enough," Adalgar immediately ended the discussion, "the less you know, the better." Adalgar knows best, you guess.

After a brief walk, the Nordic Baalist showed you to your room. Which wasnt much. Just a tight crammed room slightly bigger than a broom closet with a small thin bed on the floor, no window, and just a few little Taoist trinkets decorated in the corner of the room.

“It looks cozy,” you say with a straight face.
“Well, youre just a newcomer,” he explains, “you want a better place to sleep, you have to earn it. Just like back at home. I suggest you start by getting on Lady Kaku's good side. She's still bitter about you choosing death over conversion. And I dont think playing that pervy prank on her zombie goon won you any points.”

“Alright, I'll be good to her,” you say.
“Good. Try to get some rest. I hear theyre gonna set you up on a mission soon.”
“What kind of mission?”
“They didnt say. Anyways, goodnight.”
“Goodnight,” and with that, your fellow associates walks off, leaving you to your lonesome in this slightly cramped janitor's closet they call a bedroom. Despite being technically undead, you did feel the desire to sleep. It was humid and possibly swarming with cockroaches, but somehow you had no trouble sleeping.

And despite being technically undead, you still dreamed. You still had that same damn nightmare. That same damn memory of that same damn moment the big bright future you had ahead of yourself suddenly got pissed away.

Anyways, the urge to sleep was gone. And it's morning. You got dressed in the ceremonial garb that was already in your drawer and walked outside toward the Mausoleum's version of the mess hall. Wasnt much variety food wise that interested you. You were pretty sure some of the 'food' they served wasnt even food to begin with! But since you were hungry and craving protein you ordered what seemed the closest to edible which was curry and rice with chunks of questionable meat and carrots mixed in.

You looked for a bench to sit and eat, but far too many were already occupied by fellow taoists. If all else failed, you didnt mind standing and eating alone.

“Shiro! Over here!”

But then you heard Seiga call you out and you had no choice but to head over to the small but fancy looking dining table reserved for her and her zombie subordinate which had one extra seat vacant! You took a deep breath but obediently walked over to them. Seiga continued giving you the cold stare she's always been giving you as she dines on her exotic grilled fish entree while Yoshika was too preoccupied with digging into her huge chunk of meat still on the bone (who knows what meat!).

“Good morning Kaku-sama,” you properly address Seiga, who only stared back, “good morning, Yoshika.”
“Morning, Shoru!” Yoshika hopped with excitement, “can I munch on you again, now?” Ugh, THIS again?!
“No!”
“C'mon! Lemme taste your tasty meat again! I promise I wont bite you too hard!”
“I said no! Keep away!”
“Seiga! Tell Shobu to let me bite him!”

“As much as I'd love to let you dig in,” replied the blue-haired bitch, “he is a necessary asset. So no more biting him.”
“Awww," Yoshika lowers her head and pouts. Thankfully that was the end of that for the time being.

A brief moment of eating later, Seiga cleared her throat then drank a little before turning your direction.
“Shiro, I've just had a long conversation with Toyosatomimi last night,” she spoke, “she believes that despite your heresy, youre beneficial to the great spread of spiritual balance throughout the region and she'd like you to prove your worth.”
“I-Is it about that Yukari woman?” you asked, “I overheard her mentioning me.”
“Dont worry about THAT woman,” she responded with a tad of scorn in her voice, “and dont ever bring up her name again, ok?” Adalgar warned you.
“S-Sorry, Kaku-sama.”
“Anyways, no. Not this time,” she continued, “you see, we have a major threat that gets in the way of our goal of spiritual balance. It lives in the Myouren Temple and wishes to pervert the minds of innocent followers of faith with pure damning bollocks.”
“Is it Byakuren, Seiga?!” Yoshika interrupted.
“Yoshika, please. Ahem. As I was saying, this wicked witch of the East and her loyal toadies have gotten wind of your escapades. And since you foolishly chose not to become a proper devotee, they'll most likely try to charm you into following THEIR brainwashed ideology!”

“Dont worry Kaku-sama,” you assure her, “I'm not interested in converting PERIOD.”
Seiga's stare grew a little more cold (for obvious reasons) but then brightened her glance. “Good. Because Toyosatomimi is conjuring up a mission to have you infiltrate the Temple. Feign interest in their dangly-earlobed sleeping idol and it's rainbow-haired cultleader, then as soon as they bite the bait, gather as much information of whatever planning, and make your way back here to report on your findings.”

“When do I start?” you asked. She shrugged her shoulders.
“I dunno. As soon as she gets her big plan down, she'll let you know. In the meantime,” she wipes her mouth with the napkin prior to changing the subject, “we need to discuss your place here.” Hoo boy. “Because you chose not to be a devotee, your membership among our ranks is still very limited. Your colleague Adalgar is an exception considering his experience in his previous job which means he's a tremendous asset to us. You… still need to earn your keep.” Long story short, youre a ROOKIE.

“Uh huh,” was all you said as she kept talking.

“Ergo, your particular rank is quite a bit lower than most around here,” she states, “so you keep you acclimated, I've assigned Yoshika to be in charge of you.” HUH?!
“!!” Yoshika suddenly stopped chewing on her meat chunk as her eyes beamed with excitement! “ME?! I finally get a servant of my own to boss around now?! YAY!!!”Was she serious?! Did she really make you a servant of that brain-dead simpleton?!
“Yoshika, I'm counting on you to help train the new recruit properly,” Seiga tells her, “he's in your care, ok?”
The excited jiangshi nodded hard with determination.

“Ok Shadow!” the zombie girl turns to you with a serious determined look, “You are now Miyako-sama's property! Whatever she says goes!” This truly felt like a step down for you. A TREMENDOUS step down. Like any other step further down would send you plummeting off the face of the earth.
“Understood,” but you have to comply.
“My very first command as your master is… is… uuuuhhhh….” on second thought, should you be worried that she's your new boss or RELIEVED?! “…..give me a back massage!”

You glanced over to Seiga who simply ushered her head to her lackie.

“Ok.” as she ordered, you go behind Yoshika and begin massaging her back.
*CRAACKK!!* But just as soon as you push your fingers in her skin, they made a loud cracking sound! You were worried that you broke something you shouldnt have!
“Ooohhhh….” but she moaned with delight from it! So you continue!
*Crack!! Crack!! Crack!* her muscles went as your fingers pressed into the back of her shoulders, then traced from around her shoulder blades all the way down to her lower back.

“OooOOHH! That's the spot, Shyamalan! Dont stop! Ooooo!” She panted, drooled, even stomped her foot on the ground like a dog in absolute ecstasy as your finger popped every bad muscle all across her back with a *Crack*!

Seiga finally got sick of witnessing this little moment and decided to excuse herself.
“Well, I'll leave you two to your work. If you'll excuse me, there's a few locked chests calling my name!”
“Bye bye SeiGAAAHH*Crack!* OH YES!! YES, MAMA LIKE! MAMA LIKE!!”

Her back massage could go on forever. It was impossible to get her back to stop cracking. Although she certainly wouldnt mind if you kept on trying!

“Alright, I think that's enough,” you finally stop, “how is your back feeling?”
“A zillion times better thanks to my personal lackie!” she said with glee as the reminder that you were her lackie made you cringe, “you really are a natural. You give great massages, you know how to scrub those hard to reach places, AND you taste super yummy! I'm really glad to have you here with us.” She even gives you a thumbs up despite it possibly being a strain on her stiff joints!

And to be honest, you did feel pretty flattered by her statement. Sure it's a very ODD statement, but coming from her it's really saying something!

“Well...” you try to keep a straight face, “what shall we do next, Miyako-sama?”
11133222222211212211222221.title: The Big Step Down

1113322222221122.content:
You were probably gonna burn for this. This was most likely the worst decision you have ever made in your entire life. Which is ironic, considering this couldve been the last decision you've ever made in your entire life too. Either your faith just wasnt strong enough or youre that terrified of death so much that you deny yourself the key to the kingdom! Your family is spinning in their graves!

You take a brief moment to rethink this, but as soon as you turned your eye toward the foul smelling zombie chick that's drooling with anticipation, the moment quickly ends.

"If you need me to sedate you first, just give me the word," Adalgar offers as he pulls out a syringe.

"No, no need," you inform him, "I'll... convert."

Adalgar looked stunned, not even noticing he dropped his syringe and stabbed his foot with it! Yoshika dropped her jaw... and quite an abnormally long tongue rolled out from it.

"What?!"
"WUUUTTT??!!!" Both Adalgar and Yoshika shouted their surprise in unison.

"Are you serious?! But... I thought you were a proud Christian!" spouted your former fellow associate, "I mean, I've lost count of the number of times you've tried to convince my colleagues to attend Divine Liturgy with you!"
"Yeah, well..." you took the cross off from around your neck, "let's just say I'm beginning to doubt at this point in the game."
"OH C'MOOOONN!!!" the jiangshi whined as she hopped up and down for not getting her way, "I aint eaten live flesh in like forever!!! C'mon!!! Just a little bite!"
"Not happening, smelly!" you held your nose.
"Smelly?!" Yoshika pouted... then sniffed herself... and pouted some more, "how rude!"

You stared a bit at the cross, filling with regrets for your decision. It may have been a morally better decision to just die... but according to your former gang, youre already dead. Youre pretty sure all your friends and remaining family members already believe youre a goner. Might as well start anew with a clean state. Here's hoping you dont make the kinds of mistakes that the previous you made.

"Are you absolutely sure you want to do this?" Adalgar questioned, "because I'm gonna be honest. Even I refused to do it. I'm barred from most parts of the temple and the furthest I can excel here is quite possibly an army Lieutenant."
You bit your lip. "Yeah, I'm sure. So what do I do now?"

Both the zombie and the not-so-zombie stared blankly at you.

"I dont know," Adalgar answered, "Yoshika, what does someone who wants to be a Taoist do from here?"
She stared silently... then looked upwards, "Uhhhhhhhh... I forgot."
"What do you mean you forgot?!" the undead scandinavian snapped.
"It was like hundreds of years ago!" Paper-forehead bounced back, "how am I supposed to remember all the initiation stuff Seiga made me do?!"
"Sorry, new blood," Ratatoskr groaned, "we didnt honestly expect you were gonna change religions. This is... embarrassing, really."


"Nothing's embarrassing about wanting to be a proud member of the flock!" said a woman's voice from behind you. You quickly turn around but nothing's there... and the cross in your hand is gone! You turned back around and see a blue haired (in oriental entwined loops) woman in a blue dress with what you swear seeing is a slightly invisible white ribbon hovering around her! She smiled a smile that looked like it was sweet but hinted shady motives as she held your cross in her hand. "As a proud long-time representative of the Hall of Dreams, I welcome you, dear child!"

Adalgar forceful sucked in air, but bowed as soon as the woman faced his way.
"Hi Seiga!" Yoshika casually called out to her master.
"Lady Kaku," Adalgar took the more submissive approach, "it's a surprise to see you here. I thought you were in the middle of a sermon."

"I decided to cut it short," she stated just before turning to you with a smile, "as soon as I heard that we had such a strapping newcomer to my-OUR ranks."
Despite sensing something off about her, you politely bowed, “It's a pleasure to meet you, ma'am. Thank you for allowing me refuge in your humble abode.”
“The pleasure's all mine, child!” Seiga smirked a little wider (Adalgar exhaled hard), “thank you for taking the opportunity to open your heart to the true path toward spiritual and universal balance and understanding passed down from the teachings of Liozi… ooo, are those real diamonds?” Seiga observed the jewels encrusted on our cross, “Ahem! You'll find that the path of Tao has much to offer you. Infinitely more than any bra-stuffing budhist with really awful hair coloring can even fathom giving you besides a sexual transmitted disease.”
“Youre talking about Hijiri, right Seiga?” quipped Yoshika.
“Yoshika? How many times have I told you not to mention that bitch to me by name?”
“...Uhhhhhhh...”

“Nevermind,” Seiga sighed to her undead and possibly unclean minion while still facing you, “there's a Southern Gate that still needs guarding. Would you and Heretic Sentry Adalgar be dears and assist our Southern Guard?” 'Heretic Sentry'?
“I already know the way,” Adalgar insists, “c'mon Yoshika. Good luck, new blood.” The two of them left the scene and thankfully so did the smell. However, it didnt make you feel less uneasy, because there was something about Seiga's smile… even after she crammed your old cross down her blouse.

“Well,” you swallowed, “I'm curious. Now that I've volunteered to convert, what do I do from here?”
“Well, in all honesty, it's really not that simple,” Seiga admitted, but the smirk said otherwise, “you see, not all those interested in Taoism are accepted into the Mausoleum. Many devoted Taoists dont even earn such honor. One's spirit as well as mind and especially body must be ready to absorb the advanced teachings.”

“Is there a special class or sermon I have to attend?” you asked, “do I get baptized? ...Circumcised? Because I'm already...”
“REALLY?!” her eyes nearly beamed out of her head but she quickly shook and regained composure, “um, well child, there are certain trials and tests one must perform in order to gain true acceptance. But first of all, we do have to go through a few… ahem… particular rituals as a newcomer of Tao.” That last part almost sounded like it was ad-libbed.

You raised your eyebrow. “What kind of rituals?”

Seiga swallowed, "Well the first one... I will need you to remove all your clothes."
"WHY?" you didnt think about it for more than a nanosecond. You just immediately asked why.
"So that I can bless you!" in her hand, a jar what looked to be some type of glitter appeared in her hand.
"What's that?"
"A special blessing salt," Seiga and her smile, "I'll need to coat your nak-er, uncleansed body in it as part of the blessing." You squinted your eyes at the jar of blessing salt. It sounds a bit weird, but maybe it's cuz it's a foreign faith unfamiliar to you. Almost as unfamiliar as Seiga's smile.

"Well? What are you waiting for?" Seiga didnt want to wait, "hurry, child! Take off your clothes!"

"Good night, you'll need it for tomorrow." Mamizou smiled.

You return to your room and went back to sleep. Morning rose as you woke up, you heard the birds singing and saw the morning light. You got up and changed to your usual wear and got out. "Good morning, Lucian. Did you slept well?" Ichirin greeted.

They invited you to join them, so sat down next to Ichirin. You didn't know what was going on until Byakuren spoke first.

"In case you're wondering, Shou and Nazrin were attacked by an unknown enemy yesterday." Byakuren explained. "Mamizou saved Shou, but Nazrin was captured unfortunately. We're thinking of searching for her but..."

"But?" You asked, knowing it's something you're not going to like.

"According to Shou, this person had long black hair, green and blue heterochromia eyes, and was able to wield magic." Murasa said.

...

You didn't pay attention to the Myouren crew on where to search or why this person would take Nazrin. Byakuren then remember something about how she suspected you, as well on something that Shou said. She wanted to talk to you first, but she didn't want to keep Shou waiting.

"Are you Lucian?" The tiger asked.

"Yeah, and you're Shou, right?" You replied, and she nodded.

Shou open up the door and you all went through it. The room was like an traditional japanese dojo with the paper lanterns, and stuff like painting of tigers. You notice Shou isn't being very talkative so you decided to speak first.

"So, I heard what happen yesterday. And I heard you're going to search for her." You said. "I may not be much, but I would like to help you guys out."

Shou was in a deep thought on what you said. Her mood has brighten up from hearing that. She thinks you feel that Nazrin wouldn't have been abducted if you weren't around. Then she spoke up.

"Lucian, do you know how to fight with a sword?" Shou spoke.

"Ah, well... a bit when my friends dragged me to a few kendo matches." You look to the side with a mixer of joyful and painful memories in your head.

Shou open the case and you saw the sapphire blue scabbard with shiny metal at both ends, containing the katana with a blue hilt and an elegant silver hand guard.

"In Gensokyo, it's dangerous to go alone. Take this." Shou said.

What you hoped wouldnt be long for you to find a simple book took over 20 minutes of extensively searching through every nook and cranny! The books that werent stacked evenly on the bookshelf in the corner were also in the closet, under the bed, behind the plants, by the windowsill, and in certain drawers that didnt contain exotic (and erotic) jewelry and underwear. Sadly, not a single one was the tome you were looking for. Many of them werent in any language familiar to you. Some of them that did went over the history and location of certain intriguing relics of power like the Cronos Stone, the Eye of Odin, Izanagi's Spear... even the legendary Sword of Jerusalem. Very tempting, but you were still a novice.
The rest of the books you could understand consisted of adult-themed romance novels and some had very graphic pictures. You probably memorized at least a dozen sexual positions by name by the time you gave up looking!

On the plus side, at least you got used to the minty scent. You dont feel as stressed out as you should be wasting 20 minutes searching for something that might not be here!

And then you heard that crazy hermit suddenly humming from behind. Odd. You didnt even hear her open the door and walk in. You turn to Seiga who was carrying a pair of tea cups on a tray.

“Oh sorry to spook you,” she apologized with a sweet smile on her face, “I figured you might still a little groggy after all that happened to you. So I made you some green tea.”
“Thank you, Ms. Kaku,” you took a cup and took a little sip. Bitter. Yet strangely tangy.
“Oh no no no, you dont need to be so formal with me,” she assured you, “Just 'Mistress Seiga' is fine for me!” That generous offer made you feel uneasy. Then again, it could just be cuz the tea is a little off. Still aint too bad for you to take a couple more sips, though!

"So did you manage to find the tome?"
"No, I'm sorry," you apologized, "I've looked thoroughly, but I cant seem to find it.”

“Oh dear,” she didnt really sound so disappointed, “I certainly hope that stupid witch girl didnt sneak here and snag it.”
“Witch girl?”
“Witch THIEF is more appropriate,” she corrected herself, “it's bad enough she had to hit up some snobby rich vampire's library, now she wants to desecrate religious property? Has she no shame?” You could ask HER the same thing, but you knew better than to run your mouth.
“That's a problem,” you comment, “what if that tome has some really powerful dangerous stuff in it?”
“Oh dont worry,” she gave an assuring smile, “the dangerous spells we teach can only be conjured by pure-blooded devoted Taoists like myself. ...Hey, speaking of which, there's something I've been meaning to ask you-”
“I'm sorry, I'm not interested in converting.”

Seiga curled her lip with disappointment. “Well that's too bad. I'm sure you'd look great in a Wudang uniform.” Though thoughts of you sporting one of those while practicing kung fu techniques in a Chinese monastery seemed pretty cool, that wasnt enough to persuade you. “Anyways, I could be wrong about that witch thief. 11133222222222221.content:
Despite coming out of some eerie unearthly portal, this field youre in didnt seem completely out of the ordinary, but it did have a familiar chill. A chill you were dreading.
The chill intensified as you closed in on some sort of abandoned fortress gathering moss. There was not much to see except a few destroyed monuments, a donation box gathering cobwebs, and lots of candles long burned out. These ruins looked to have been abandoned for ages. Yet, you didnt feel lonely. The chill was there.

“STOP RIGHT THERE TRAITOR!”
“Aint nowhere to run now, asshole!”

Damnit! Idiots! Why did they have to still follow you?! If only they realized. You werent running for your life! You were running for THEIRS! You were trying to SAVE them. If only they didnt follow you, they wouldnt be targets. From your guardian angel.

The angel of death.

You dont know who she is or why she follows you, but for some goddamned reason, she would never leave you alone. Near the unfortunately end of your career as a young respected mafioso, you had sightings of a white-haired angel in a blue dress with a glowing shield-like insignia on it wielding an orb scepter. Once in a while, you could spot her in the distance, through the window or reflection in the rear view mirror, sometimes while you sleep you could barely see her over your bed watching you.

At first you thought you were seeing things. Then she started doing things.
The angel killed. Whenever your life was in danger, your perpetrator would meet his often gruesome end via her divine intervention.
When you were threatened in an alley by rival gangsters, she was there to break their necks. When hitmen shot up your safehouse, she was there to propel a few of their own bullets into their skulls. When a truck almost ran you over, an ungodly beam of destructive light blew it right off the road. Dang near every one of your boss's enemies that went up against you, died screaming, you could hear their screams echo when you sleep.
You moved up the ranks fast thanks to her, but then your own colleagues went up against you too. When Paulo got drunk and challenged you to a fight out back, your angel learned how flammable his booze-soaked carcass was. Paulo's friends came after you… they were founded dumped in open graves the next morning. Mr. Salvatore's son Leo tried to put a hit on you… all the kings horse's and all the king's men couldnt put Leo's chopped up body back together again. That was the final straw with your boss. Mr. Salvatore had you escorted to his office tied up and gagged so he could put you down himself… by the time you came to, you were freed and surrounded by a pile of fellow associates with their throats torn open!

“Guys! You need to get away!” you pleaded with those goons as they descended toward you with guns pointed your way, “you need to get outta here!”
“You fucking ungrateful brat,” spits one of your stubborn associates, “Mr. Salvatore took your worthless ass out of the gutter and THIS is the thanks you give him?!”
“For the last time, I didnt kill him!” you explained yourself, “I didnt kill any of them! Sariel did!”
“Shut up!” the other guy screamed, “shut the fuck up! I'm getting tired of listening to your bullshit!”
“I swear! Sariel's doing all this!” you try to talk sense into them, “you guys need to run or she'll hurt you too!” No luck.

“Say your prayers, traitor!” You gave a quick silent prayer that your guardian angel would spare these fools.

Your prayer fell on deaf ears.

Just as soon as he could pull the trigger, you caught a glimpse of one your former comrades set ablaze! He let out a howling roar of agony as Sariel's Hellfire consumed his body!
The other guy panicked, looking around, pointing the gun in all directions. He shouldve looked up.

“Gyaagghh!” you paled at the sight of that gunman's neck squeezed beyond the breaking point in Sariel's grip! You could hear his throat cave in from the tight superhuman grip. You hoped he completely suffocated before she set his body a light in Hellfire and tossed his burning corpse to the darkness!

Now it was just you and her. The chills intensified as she locked eyes with you. You shivered like a frightened cat. Of all the times you spent in the mafia when your life was actually threatened, this was the only moment that truly made you want to curl into a ball and find a happy place. You wanted to wake up from this horrible nightmare, but you just couldnt open your damn eyes!

You shivered and shook and mumbled under breath as Sariel approached you, possibly intrigued by your fear!

“S-S-STAY BACK!!” you pointed your gun at her, “DONT C-COME ANY CLOSER!!” Sariel showed no change in her emotionless facade. Either she knew your gun was ineffective against an angel of death or she knew it was even loaded!
What is it with this woman?! What the hell does she want from you?! Why is she so interested in 'protecting' you?!

Whatever the reason, pointing an empty gun at an angel is not gonna solve your problems. Perhaps it'd be in your best interest to just drop your gun and give yourself up. Maybe you'll find some answers that way.

But just as you were about to, you noticed the temple's doors suddenly opened. A potential means of escape? Are you kidding? What makes you think whatever's inside is any safer than here?!
Then again, what makes you think it isnt? Can you trust HER any more than whatever's within the ruined temple?
Speaking of trust, she did save your life multiple times… dont you kinda owe her?

Either way, Sariel is still approaching you. Better make up your mind fast.
11133222222222221.title: My Guardian Angel and I

You smiled and pointed your uzi and shot many rounds of fire bullets. The young man fell to his death and you got up with huge smile.

"This power...it's awsome." You said, "With this I can find that defector....now lets see.."

You fiddled with the power little and a huge gap opened. You went through and once it closed you arrived in...
